author: COMSOL
description: In this example the thermoviscous acoustic wave field in a shallow uniform waveguide is modeled and compared to an analytical solution. Because of the small waveguide height (1 mm) the thermal and viscous boundary layers are significant.
label: uniform_layer_waveguide.mph
name: root

settings.description: Viscous boundary layer thickness of air at 20 degrees C and 1 atm
settings.name: d_visc

settings.description: May produce complex output for real arguments
settings.name: complex

settings.name: complex

settings.name: complex

settings.name: complex

settings.name: SizeControlParameter

settings.description: Number of mesh elements per wavelength
settings.name: ElementsPerWavelength

settings.description: Reference pressure for the sound pressure level
settings.name: ReferenceType

settings.description: Avoid inverted elements by curving interior domain elements
settings.name: curvedinterior

description: Initial values of variables solved for
settings.name: useinitsol

description: Values of variables not solved for
settings.name: usesol

settings.description: Split complex variables in real and imaginary parts
settings.name: splitcomplex

settings.description: Use thread scheduling for matrix assembly
settings.name: optthread

settings.description: Use static distribution of assembly blocks
settings.name: statblockdistr

settings.description: Allow complex-valued output from functions with real input

settings.name: clusterpardiso

settings.description: Store solution for all intermediate study steps

title: Uniform Layer Waveguide
